_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Euticals Inc. is a manufacturer of pharmaceutical and fine chemicals.  This executive summary provides an overview of the site Risk Management Program.



POLICY



Euticals is committed to operating our facilities safely and in compliance with all applicable regulations.   Euticals considers responsible management of Environmental, Safety and Health considerations as an integral component of our business.  All employees must assume responsibility for process safety consistent with their function and level of authority. 



FACILITY OVERVIEW AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



Euticals Inc. produces materials for use in pharmaceuticals and fine chemicals.  These materials include both active pharmaceutical ingredients and chemicals used as pharmaceutical intermediates and fine chemicals.  The facility is located on 66 acres and employs approximately 80 people including more than 25 chemists and engineers.  The facility operations are regulated by the FDA, OSHA, DEA, EPA, MDNR and Federal, State and local agencies.  The facility manufacturing operations are conducted 24 hours/day, 7 days/week and Euticals employees staff the facility 365 days per year.  



The RMP regulated substance at Euticals is Acrylyl Chloride (ACC) which is used in the manufacture of an intermediate specialty chemical.  The facility purchases ACC in drums with net weight of 441 lbs.  Only one drum is connected to the manufacturing process at a time.  ACC is consumed in a chemical reaction very rapidly as it is charged to the process so 441 pounds is the manufacturing process maximum inventory.  No more than three full drums are staged in the process area at one time.



Acrylyl Chloride is used in only one manufacturing process at Euticals.  ACC is stored in a segregated area and no flammable materials are stored in this compartment.  The storage area is segregated from all processing facilities, offices, and high-population areas.  



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMS 



This facility has been

in operation since 1947.  The site has mature safety programs that meet or exceed OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) and EPA's Risk Management Plan (RMP) requirements.  Euticals has developed prevention programs for all regulated chemicals.  The success of these prevention programs is reflected in Euticals' excellent safety performance.  Euticals' prevention programs are comprised of technology-, personnel-, and facilities-related elements.



Technology-related elements include safety systems in the processes (control systems, alarms, interlocks, etc), process hazards analysis (PHA), operating procedures and safe practices, and management of change (MOC).  These elements are utilized to manage all physical, procedural, and technical changes made on this site.  A plant-wide database is used for tracking MOCs and PHAs.  



Facilities-related elements that significantly contribute to the success of the prevention program include the mechanical integrity program and the pre-startup safety reviews (PSSR). The mechanical integrity program is a comprehensive maintenance program that to assure proper equipment preventative maintenance and equipment quality assurance.  



Personnel-related elements include formal training and incident investigation.  Both of these programs utilize database systems to maintain and organize records so that site personnel are able to track plant performance in these areas.



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



In accordance with RMP reporting requirements, Euticals is pleased to report that there have been no RMP accidents at Euticals that have resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site.  There have also been no offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS



Euticals Inc. has established an integrated contingency response plan to define the procedures and activities necessary to manage chemical incidents.  Chemical operators and main

tenance mechanics complete an initial 24-hour certified hazardous material training course and at least 8-hours of refresher training each year.  All shift supervisors complete certified emergency response incident command training.



Euticals works with the Local Emergency Planning Committee and Emergency Management Office to assure these planning and response organizations are familiar with the Euticals site.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Euticals believes continuous improvement of all safety systems is crucial to the ongoing success of the company.  Continuous improvement and review of safety programs are conducted to assure means of improving site safety performance are fully explored.  All incidents are investigated to assure causative factors are identified and corrected.  Plant safety procedures are regularly reviewed to assure they are appropriate and accurate.  These and other programs have resulted in numerous improvements to safety at Euticals and will continue to do so.
